title: Finish redesign for version 0.4.0
Implement graphviz export of dataflow graph
Update readme and documentation
body:
- Cleans up the README.
- Add reference to D3 paper.

title: Cleanup APIs and examples
body:
- Getters comply with [Rust naming conventions](https://rust-lang.github.io/api-guidelines/naming.html#getter-names-follow-rust-convention-c-getter).
- Remove outdated Python examples.

title: Bump PyO3 version and fix CI
body:
- Bumps pyo3 to 0.16.0 and moves dunder methods from `pyproto` implementation to `pymethods` (documented [here](https://pyo3.rs/master/class/protocols.html)).
- Remove `clippy::unneeded_option_deref` from CI build arguments.

title: [LINQ] Add timestamp join
body:
Introduces the `TimestampJoin`, which joins messages with matching timestamps from two different streams by performing a cartesian product. I've tested the operator locally, and it seems to work.

A few things I wasn't sure about that can hopefully be addressed in review:
1. Consistent naming: `TimestampJoin` seems more ergonomic, but this should be named `TimestampJoinOperator` to stay consistent with the other operators.
2. Example: I wasn't sure how to best add the timestamp join to the existing LINQ and full pipeline examples. These examples may also need to be revamped.

title: [CI] Fail on warnings when building Rust docs
body:
- The rustdoc check fails if building the documentation produces any warnings.
- Enables all features when building the documentation.
- Fixes errors in the documentation, add iterates on ROS operator documentation.
- Adds caching to the rustdoc workflow, reducing run times in CI from ~2.5 minutes to ~30 seconds.

title: [CI] Enable Clippy linting and separate formatting checks.
body:
- Enables Clippy linting on the Rust code, and fixed code to conform to the warnings raised. There seems to be a bug in the Clippy linting that does not respect an `#[allow(needless_option_as_deref)]` on the `new` method of the `PyMessage` class, so it was added as a global allow for now. 
- Separates Formatting checks for Rust and Python into separate jobs, and makes the builds depend on the formatting checks to succeed first.
- Package builds are now cached at the formatting stage, which allows the Rust/ROS/Python builds to use the cache instead of rebuilding the dependencies in parallel.

title: [Python] Support serializing message data before sending
body:
Adds the `Message._serialize_data()` method which serializes the message's data field using `pickle`. When the message is sent, the data field does not need to be serialized again which reduces the cost of sending the message.

Also updates some documentation.

title: [Bug] Stream.name() -> Stream.name, enable access to global AbstractGraph from multiple threads
body:
Fixes bugs affecting the Pylot redesign.
1. Some pieces of Python code were calling the method `stream.name()`, which has been deprecated in favor of the property `stream.name`.
2. The `AbstractGraph` was inaccessible from different threads. This causes errors, e.g. when an `IngestStream` is moved to another thread in order to send messages from a CARLA-managed callback, and the `IngestStream`'s name is accessed.

title: Replace YAPF with Black + isort in CI
body:
- Adds a `setup_hooks.sh` script to install `pre-commit` and initialize it.
- Added [`isort`](https://github.com/PyCQA/isort) to the pre-commit hooks for automatic sorting of Python imports.
- Ran `isort` on all Python files.

title: [CI] Fix Python build issues
body: Adds `toml` as a dependency and fixes `flake8` and `yapf` versions to allow CI builds to run.

title: [Bug] Fix connect_two_in_one_out
body:
Fixes a bug where `connect_two_in_one_out` would instantiate two copies of the same write stream during execution, rather than one for the left write stream and another for the right write stream.

Also does some code cleanup.

title: [Python] Update documentation
body:
- Updates documentation.
- Fixes pythondoc CI.

title: Reintroduce Stream trait, add PyStream base class
Implement TimeVersionedState and clean up State API.
body:
TODOS:
- Add documentation once the PR is approved.

title: [LINQ] Replace MapOperator with FlatMapOperator, and add flat_map to API.
body:
- Replaces `MapOperator` with a more general `FlatMapOperator`.
- Updates documentation.
- Fixes examples and tests.

title: Fix doctests for ROS operators.
body:
- Mocks `rosrust_msg` library for the ROS doctests.
- Only compiles (and does not run) the tests for `IngestStream` and `ExtractStream` since they run a ROS node.

title: [LINQ] Add concat operator
Add OperatorConfig to operator run method
body:
* Adds a `config: &OperatorConfig` to all operators
* Updated examples and ros operators
* `config` is currently unused in the Python interface (Rust warnings)

title: [LINQ] Add example, and traits for filter, map, split
body: Here are just the Rust LINQ Operators

title: Speed up CI
body: Fixes the CI rust toolchain version and uses [rust-cache](https://github.com/Swatinem/rust-cache) to cache dependencies and speed up CI runs.

title: Update and remove tests
body: Comment out tests for important data structures that may be removed/heavily modified later (`OperatorEvent`, `ExecutionLattice`).

title: Add examples crate, ROS integration to CI
Restructure project layout
body:
- Reorganizes project into workspace containing 2 crates (erdos and python).
- Switches from `setuptools_rust` to `maturin` for managing Python distributions.
- Pin Rust version to `nightly-2021-12-04`.
- Remove benchmarks and extra dependencies.
- Update Dockerfile and CI.

title: [Rust] Add ROS Operators
body:
* Adds `to_ros_operator` and `from_ros_operator` which operate on generic types
* Examples for how to use each placed in new `examples/` directory

Known issues:
* Each operator has a `rosrust::init()`, so only 1 operator can be used in an erdos application. Workaround is to only initialize once globally, library allows multiple nodes running on the same process.
* `from_erdos` example publishes rosrust::RawMessage, which is a serialized version of the original String

title: [Bug] Fix Python node configuration and remove slog
body: Fixes issues introduced by #185 regarding the Python integration.

title: Switch logging to tracing from slog
body:
Switches logging to [tracing](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tracing) from [slog](https://github.com/slog-rs/slog).

## Additional Changes
- More customization for logging via the Node configuration and command line interfaces.
- Rename `num_worker_threads` to `num_threads` to distinguish from the worker tasks.

## Advantages of tracing
- Supports [spans](https://docs.rs/tracing/0.1.29/tracing/#spans) for monitoring the progress/duration code contexts. I've found this useful for concurrent debugging.
- Tracing integrates with Tokio and provides support for async contexts.
- Don't need to pass a logger when recording events.
- Support for additional logging interfaces (e.g. writing to file, integrating with [OpenTelemetry](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tracing/tree/master/tracing-opentelemetry)).
- Easy to add additional information such as current OS thread.

## Advantages of slog
- Slightly better measured performance
   - 1.3 us/event for slog with slog-async-drain vs. 3 us/event for tracing with tracing-appender.
   - In these measurements, the slog's asynchronous logger dropped most events.
- Users can instantiate that are independent of ERDOS.

title: [Bug] Fix possible deadlock in operator executors
body:
Deadlocks could occur because functions generating operator events for messages and callbacks sometimes acquire locks in different orders.


## Example

The message callback in `OneInOneOutExceutor` acquires a lock on the operator before the state:
https://github.com/erdos-project/erdos/blob/54c2a4db7bbef272de8ad09e578a8188ddae0f3d/src/node/operator_executors/one_in_one_out_executor.rs#L344-L354

Whereas the watermark callback acquires a lock on the state before the operator:
https://github.com/erdos-project/erdos/blob/54c2a4db7bbef272de8ad09e578a8188ddae0f3d/src/node/operator_executors/one_in_one_out_executor.rs#L406-L421

title: [Python] Add name property and setter to Stream
[Python] Add ID property to ExtractStream, IngestStream
body:
* Similar changes like #181 
* Examples tested to work

title: [Python] Add ID property to ReadStream, WriteStream
body:
* Examples are tested to be working
* Add read-only ID property to py_read_stream and py_write_stream

title: [Python] Add name setters and getters
body:
* Add name setters and getters to PyStream, PyIngestStream, PyReadStream, PyWriteStream
* Remove `_name` from Python constructors
* Add set_name to streams in Python

title: [Bug] Fix bug with loops in dataflow
body:
Fixes a bug with loops in the dataflow.

- Resolve operator read stream IDs when they correspond to a loop when compiling the `AbstractGraph`.
- Resolve operator read stream IDs in the `OperatorRunner`  closures.
- Fix the Python loop stream example.
- Introduce a `coordinates` property for the python `Timestamp` class.

Note that loop streams can only be passed as inputs to operators, and therefore write stream IDs aren't affected.

title: Fix cargo doc warnings and improve documentation
body:
Fixes warnings that appear when calling `cargo doc`.

Also updates the documentation for many files which were emitting warnings.

This PR does not intend to update all documentation for the redesign, and documentation should be further improved in follow-up PRs.

title: [Bug] Fix error when streams have no destination operators
body: Previously, the `JobGraph` assumed that each stream would have a destination operator. This PR fixes this assumption, and improves error messages.

title: [Python] Fix connect for IngestStream, LoopStream, and update examples
body:
* Add `to_py_stream` methods to PyLoopStream and PyIngestStream
* Connect methods check input streams to be of type `Stream`, `IngestStream`, or `LoopStream`
* Update `close_streams.py` example for redesign

title: Update watermark example, Fix Timestamp bug
body: Updates to `watermarks.py` for redesign, and fix in `streams.py` when parsing a message that is a watermark.

title: Update join streams example
body: Updated `join_streams.py` to use erdos redesign

title: Update simple pipeline example
body:
Changes:
* Update `simple_pipeline.py` for erdos redesign
* Fix multiprocessing process issue on macOS for Python 3.8+

title: Refactor graph and streams
body:
Refactors the stream API and the internal graph implementation.

When setting up the dataflow graphs, operators and streams are registered to an `AbstractGraph`.
The `AbstractGraph` is then compiled into a `JobGraph` to solve loops.
The `JobGraph` is then executed.

title: Finished new redesigned MapOperator, FilterOperator, and SplitOperator
Implement Timestamp deadlines for TwoInMessageProcessor
body:
- Invokes `setup` for all operator types.
- Implements timestamp deadlines for the `TwoInMessageProcessorT`.
- Cleans up redundant code.

title: Redesigned Python API
Run IngestStreams and ExtractStreams on Node 0
body:
Modifies IngestStreams and ExtractStreams to run on node 0, which is a first step towards providing a single driver for ERDOS programs.

As a temporary solution, the dataflow graph places ingest and extract streams on node 0. I'll improve this abstraction in a follow-up PR in which I'm planning to refactor the dataflow graph.

title: Upgrade tokio to 1.8.1
Timestamp deadlines [WIP]
Added more mostly internal code comments.
Operator Redesign [WIP]
body: This PR tracks the changes for the redesign of the ERDOS API that separates the `ReadOnly` and `Writeable` operators.
